Tabrakan Dengan Perahu Nelayan, Kapal BPPT Tengah Survey Perairan Banten
02 Nov 2019, 23:41 by Syahdan Alamsyah
Sukabumi - Satu orang nelayan hilang dan dua lainnya berhasil dievakuasi setelah perahu congkreng yang mereka tumpangi terlibat kecelakaan dengan Kapal Baruna Jaya 1 milik Badan Pengkajian dan Penerapan Teknologi (BPPT) Sabtu (2/11/2019) siang tadi.
Kepala Kantor SAR Jakarta Hendra Sudirman, melalui Kepala Seksi Operasi dan Siaga Kantor SAR Jakarta, I Made Oka Astawa menyebut saat ini proses evakuasi dua nelayan telah dilakukan anggotanya bersama Kansar Banten berkoordinasi dengan Polair dan HNSI.


Foto: Proses evakuasi nelayan (Dok Kansar Jakarta)

"Informasi yang kami terima kapal Baruna Jaya sedang melakukan survei secara tiba - tiba kapal nelayan muncul dari lambung kiri haluan dan menabrak haluan. Kapal berusaha menghindar tapi karena jarak sudah dekat sehingga (tabrakan) tidak bisa dihindari," kata Oka melalui sambungan telepon dengan detikcom.
Oka menjelaskan proses evakuasi saat ini masih dilakukan, dua nelayan berhasil diselamatkan. "Berlanjut proses pencarian satu nelayan lagi," lanjutnya.

Collision With Fishing Boat, BPPT Vessel Middle Banten Waters Survey
02 Nov 2019, 23:41 by Syahdan Alamsyah
Sukabumi - One fisherman was missing and two others were successfully evacuated after the congkreng boat they were traveling in was involved in an accident with the Baruna Jaya 1 Ship belonging to the Technology Assessment and Application Agency (BPPT) Saturday (2/11/2019) this afternoon.
Head of the Jakarta SAR Office Hendra Sudirman, through the Head of Operations and Standby Section of the Jakarta SAR Office, I Made Oka Astawa, said that currently the evacuation process of two fishermen had been carried out by their members together with Kansar Banten in coordination with Polair and HNSI.


Photo: The evacuation process of fishermen (Dok Kansar Jakarta)

"The information we received aboard the Baruna Jaya was conducting a sudden survey of fishing boats emerging from the left hull of the bow and crashing into the bow. The ship tried to avoid but because the distance was near so (collision) could not be avoided," Oka said via telephone line with AFP .
Oka explained that the evacuation process was still underway, two fishermen were rescued. "The process of finding one more fisherman continues," he continued.
